alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 9:18AM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Emory River At Oakdale TN affecting Roane and Morgan Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...The river has crested at the 27.0 foot flood stage. * WHERE...Emory River at Oakdale TN. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flooding starts on Riverview Road. Homes closest to the river can have up to about 4 feet of water in them, while homes on the far side of the street will have flooded yards. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 27.0 feet. The river has crested. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.0 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.0 feet on 05/07/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
